intro: Phagnalon garamantum, commonly known as the Garamantian phagnalon, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to the arid regions of North Africa and the Middle East, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It has narrow, linear leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss in its harsh environment. Phagnalon garamantum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
